column1: fuller around off, a hint of swing in, Short punches it firmly towards mid-off
fuller again, too full actually and Short almost had to dig it out, once again to mid-off
straying on the pads this time, once again on the fuller side. Short fails to put it away
this one leaves Short. Just moving away from the good length. Short was playing inside the line and gets beaten. Bounces just before the keeper
off the mark finally. Punches it towards mid-off for a single
brilliant bowling this from Worrall. Nail the good length around fourth stump and moves it away, Jacks was looking to drive on the up and gets beaten
length ball on the pads, pushed away towards midwicket
length ball on middle and leg, gets forward and blocks
the first big hit of the day. Jacks uses his feet, reaches almost to the pitch of the ball before extending his arms to launch it over long-on
flatter and quicker on the leg stump, Jacks goes back and defends
use of feet once again to take this on the full, pushes it towards mid-off
fired in outside off, a low full toss and Short smashes it over covers for four more
length ball outside off, stands tall and punches it through covers for a couple
a brilliant stop by Briggs at short extra cover, was a touch fuller from Worrall and Jacks hit it on the gap, couldn't find the gap though
length ball, around middle and leg, Jacks works it around the corner
fuller on the stumps, Short was looking to go towards long-on but gets the inner half of the bat, which takes the ball towards midwicket
fuller around off and smashed between the bowler and mid-off. There hasn't been any swing for Worrall this over, he may have to shorten his length
length outside off, Jacks opens the face of the bat at impact to work it towards point but a diving stop prevents any runs
and he has been dispatched to the deep square leg boundary first ball. Was a short of length ball on middle and leg, Short moved inside the line and pulled it away
length ball outside off, punched towards extra cover off the back foot
fuller at the batsman, Short was giving himself some room but can push it only towards mid-on
a full toss around off stumps, Short bunts it down to long-on as Siddle gets away with it
short of length outside off and Jacks pulls it away. Sounded good off the bat but there is a man at deep midwicket
fuller, following short who gets some bat on this yorker, and collects a single
length ball outside off, punched through the off side, sweeper covers makes a sliding stop to his right
short of length at off stump, Jacks clears his front leg and smashes it through midwicket, gets a boundary
a swing and a miss. A length ball angling in, Jacks looks to go leg side once again but misses as the ball keeps coming in with the angle
slower length ball outside off, around 120kph, Jacks had enough width but he finds deep extra cover with the cut
length ball but down the leg side, needs to be bowled again
that one came slower off the wicket and Short who was late to react almost pushes it back to the bowler. Speedgun recorded 145kph
short of length outside off, steered towards third man
fuller on the pads, Short goes for the flick but doesn't get any bat on it. They run a leg-bye to short fine leg
and he slips in a googly, Jacks goes back and works it behind square leg
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards long-off
an appeal for stumping as Jacks loses his balance while trying to reverse-sweep this length ball outside off. But his foot was grounded, so an easy one for the TV umpire
fuller around off, comes forward and defends and Rashid sprints to prevent any chance of a single
length ball outside off, Jacks goes low on his knee and paddles him fine for a couple
starts with a short one on the leg stump, Short goes deep and pulls it behind square leg for four
another one down the leg side but Short cannot connect the pull as it's too wide
length ball on the leg stump, tucked away towards square leg
into the stands. Brings out the slog sweep. Was a length ball on the stumps and Jacks sends it over deep midwicket
fired in the blockhole at 98kph, jams his bat at it to squeeze in a single
length ball just outside off, too close to cut it. Short ends up dabbing it towards short third man
fires in a low full toss, pushed towards long-off
short of length outside off, looked like a slower one, pulled towards deep square leg. Yeah, was a legcutter
short of length again, pulled away towards deep midwicket
short of length at the stumps, backs away and punches it towards deep extra cover

dropped by Worrall at fine leg. Short of length and Short went for the pull, got a top edge, and Worrall settled under it alright but didn't have his hands in the best position and the ball bursts through them
short of length outside off, pulls it towards deep midwicket
flicked towards deep midwicet
short of length at the batsman, backs away and steers it towards third man
length ball and Jacks looks to slog it over deep midwicket. Gets only the height as Gibson pouches it inside the circle, near the short midwicket area
a nippy bouncer from Agar, Short was looking to pull it away but pulls out in the end
short of length outside off, Short fails to connect the cut
short of length at the batsman, some extra bounce means Short removes his top hand and plays it down towards the off side.
short of length, straight at the batsman, Short arches back and dabs it towards third man. Only two runs and a wicket from that over
brilliant stop by Renshaw at deep midwicket, flying to his left. Was a length ball and Short went for the slog sweep
a high full toss on the leg stump and Ingram works it towards midwicket to get off the mark
length ball at the stumps, goes back and turns it towards square leg
a googly this time, length ball at the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
length ball on the pads, was looking to work on the leg side, misses but the impact was way outside the leg stump
length ball on the stumps, pushed towards midwicket and they scamper back for the second
fuller outside off and Short smashes it through extra cover
in the blockhole and at the stumps, digs it out back
flatter, quicker and fuller. Pushed towards mid-off
fuller outside off, hits it through extra cover for one more
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, drives it inside out towards long-off
length ball around off, punched towards mid-off
short of length and pulled towards deep square leg
short and pulled away, one bounce to deep midwicket
a high full toss around off, and Ingram puts it away over extra cover for four
biggie! In the slot around off stump and Ingram smashes it over long-on, into the crowds for a 90m-six
fuller on the pads and clipped towards deep midwicket for two more
fuller on the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
slightly flighted but the line and length remain same, driven towards long-on
goes low and paddles it towards short fine leg
gives himself some room and flicks it towards wide long-on, only a single
backs away and goes inside out, drives it towards the right of long-off
fuller and not giving any room, pushed back towards Renshaw
short of length around off, goes for the cut but cannot middle it, the ball dribbles towards short third man
fuller outside off, and Short launches it over long-off, his first six of the day
a full toss this time and Short needs no second invitation, this has been dispatched over deep midwicket as Short gets to his fifty off 42 balls
a googly, but enough room outside off and Short cuts it through covers, the sweeper cover puts in a sliding effort, gets his hand to it but cannot stop the boundary
brings out the slog sweep, and off it goes into the deep midwicket stands, 96 metres that one. Short has really turned it around in this over, and against arguably the best T20 bowler around
fuller outside off and Short hits it hard towards midwicket, gets two more to make it a 25-run over
short of length at the batsman, pulls it towards short fine leg
slower length ball, backs away and chips it over the cover fielder, looking in full control now
flicks it into the hills. Shuffles across and picks it up off his pads and sends it over fine leg, another six for Short

and that's end of Short's innings. Looked like a slower one. Short backed away and looked to go over point but instead it went towards short third man where Worrall took a couple of steps back and made no mistake this time
fuller on the pads, flicks it towards short fine leg
short of length at the batsman, backs away and chops it towards short third man
fuller on the stumps, hits it towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, backs away to work it towards midwicket
on the pads and chips it towards deep midwicket, one bounce to the fielder
uses his feet to convert this into a low full toss, only a single to deep midwicket

short of length outside off and Ingram goes for the big hit. Pulls it towards deep midwicket but doesn't have enough legs on it, Rashid pedals back and takes it comfortable, balances himself with a couple of hops before throwing it in the air, stepping out and coming back in to complete the catch
fuller on the stumps from around the wicket, driven towards the left of mid-on who makes a partial stop to keep it to one
Rashid strikes now. Nice and full on the off stump, a wrong 'un. Handscomb goes for the sweep but misses. Was the impact outside off, looked like but the umpire had no doubt in his mind
length ball, another googly, turns it towards short fine leg
fuller outside off, goes down on his knee and sweeps it towards deep midwicket
fuller outside off and driven towards deep extra cover
another googly around off, pitching on a length. Goes back to flick but misses. An appeal for lbw but looked a touch high
length ball on the stumps, turns it towards deep midwicket
a low full toss around off, bunts it towards long-on
shuffled across to paddle it fine, was a low full toss and Wright missed it completely. The ball hits the leg stump as Hurricanes lose their fifth
a full toss on the leg stump and helped towards short fine leg
a high full toss this time, called a no-ball straightaway. Taps it towards deep square leg
fuller outside off, an offcutter. David clears his front leg and smashes this freebie over long-off
fuller outside off, almost a yorker, squeezes it out towards deep cover
another high full toss and this has been pulled towards deep midwicket for a couple. Called a no-ball for height, the second time
fires it in the blockhole. Digs it out to long-on
length ball outside off, drags it towards deep midwicket
short of length outside off, goes for the pull but ends up hitting it towards long-on. Good running there as they come back for the second
a wide yorker at 140-plus kph, David cannot get his bat on that
short of length outside off, pulled towards deep midwicket. A good sliding stop by Renshaw there to keep it to one
slower length ball outside off, David swings across but the ball sneaks underneath his bat
another slower one, fuller outside off, flicked towards deep midwicket
fuller at the stumps, but Faulkner shuffles across and just scoops it fine
short of length outside off, backs away and cuts it towards extra cover
fuller on the stumps, hits it towards long-on and they come back for the second
length ball at the stumps, mistime the pull towards long-on. Looked like a legcutter from Siddle
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards deep square leg
fuller outside off, hits it towards deep extra cover and they are scampering back for the second. Faulkner had to put in the dive to make it to the crease
fuller outside off, Salt looks to go over extra cover, gets a thick outside edge to third man
fuller on the stumps and he clears his front leg to work it towards midwicket
fuller and swinging away, drives it firmly but extra cover comes in the way
fuller on the stumps, squaring up the batsman with the awayswing. A thick outside edge rolls towards covers
fuller on the pads, hits it towards deep midwicket, was in the air for a while but safe
fuller outside off, taps it towards backward point
fuller on the stumps, worked away towards long-on
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards mid-on

Faulkner takes a brilliant catch. Short of length but wasn't that short too pull, Weatherald went for the pull but mistimed it horribly. Faulkner had to dive forward at mid-on to take it inches off the ground
fuller around off, drives it towards short midwicket
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards mid-on
fuller outside off, looks to hit it through wide mid-on, gets a thin inside edge past the stumps
fuller and swinging in, Salt misses the flick and is hit on the pads, was heading down though
length outside off, guides it towards short third man. A bit of chit-chat between Faulkner and Renshaw
fuller outside off and Renshaw goes over mid-off, not the best of the timings but what a stop by Wright, I think to chase it down and pull it back
fuller around off, drills it towards mid-off for one
fuller outside off, swings across for a single to deep backward square leg
bowls 'im. Was a length ball pitching on middle and off and swinging back in to beat the bat. Hits the off stump. May have even brushed the pads on its way
length ball around off, a tentative push to Botha's right
a low full toss around off, hits it along the ground towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, clipped towards square leg
arm ball around off, Nielsen was going for the cut but the ball kept coming in to cramp him
uses his feet but gets too close to the ball. Had to dig it out in the end
tossed up on a length around off, pushes it back towards the bowler. Was in the air but safe
length ball outside off, steered it towards deep backward point
length ball around off and leaving the batsman. Nielsen pushes at it and gets beaten
fuller outside off, moves across and looks to work it on the leg side but gets a leading edge of sorts down the ground
length ball outside off, cuts it towards deep backward point for one more
length ball around off, punched towards mid-off
a touch fuller around off, punched back towards the bowler
length outside off, goes for the cut but David at the backward point makes a diving stop to his right
slog sweep now and he connects it alright to find the four at deep midwicket
uses his feet to work it towards long-on
fuller outside off but the line doesn't matter for Renshaw who absolutely nails the slog sweep, deep into the deep midwicket crowd
length ball outside off, punched towards midwicket from the back foot
fuller on the stumps, Nielsen was looking to use his feet and work it towards midwicket but ends up playing all around it. Misses and gets trapped right in front
short of length outside off, steered behind point

Meredith strikes now. First-ball duck for Wells. Length ball at the stumps, Wells was caught on the crease and looked to work it on the leg side in the end but was too late by then as the ball skidded through to hit the pads
length ball attacking the stumps, flicked towards fine leg
length outside off, goes for the cut but misses
length ball around off, taps it towards point
a bouncer this time, Gibson ducks under as another successful over ends
length ball around off, mistimes the pull towards short midwicket
slower length ball outside off, pulls it in front of square leg for a couple, good sliding effort by Botha at the fence
slower length ball outside off, and a swing and a miss
length ball on the stumps, goes for the pull again and misses again, gets a leg-bye though this time
a top edge on the pull this time. Banged in short and Gibson went for it, sails over the wicketkeeper's head
length ball around off, goes back and turns it towards square leg, and collects two as the fielder was on the fence
length outside off, makes room and goes for the cut. No connection
length ball around off, stays back and turns it towards midwicket for a couple. Played with the soft hands

Brilliant football skills from Meredith result in Gibson being run out. It was a fuller delivery around off, Renshaw looks to go leg side, gets an inside edge on to the pads and sets off as the ball stops just outside the crease. Meredith charged towards the ball and kicked it on to the stumps to find Gibson just short

and now he gets a wicket. Short of length and Rashid goes for the pull, only to top-edge it behind the wicket. Handscomb pedalled back and always looked like he was going to take it comfortably and he does exactly that
fuller outside off, steered towards deep extra cover
length ball outside off, looks to punch it through the off side and misses but Meredith has overstepped
length ball outside off, pulls it away but a good stop by short midwicket
length ball around off, Renshaw goes big but cannot get the distance as it lands well short of long-off
short of length outside off, fended towards third man
fuller outside off and Renshaw clears his front leg to launch it over long-off
fuller and wider, reaches out for it for a single to point
wide, way down the leg side
fuller on the stumps and Worrall launches it over the bowler's head for the second six of the over
slower short ball, goes for the pull but cannot time it and they get only a single. And that's Boost point for the Hurricanes. They would like to finish it early
short of length outside off, cuts it away past point for four
fuller around off, swings hard but cannot beat the short midwicket
short of length at the stumps, Worrall bends his back and upper cuts it for four
fuller on the stumps, Worrall was moving towards the leg side, and manages to get bat on it
length ball at the stumps, was looking to give himself some room once again, gets an under edge that bounces past the stumps
lands safely. Short of length around off and Worrall goes for the pull. Gets a top edge that falls between fine leg and deep-backward square leg
slower one. Fuller on the stumps, defended back
another slower one, this time wide outside off, hits it down the ground for a single
fuller on the pads and Renshaw aims to go over deep midwicket but fails to middle. And a comfortable catch for Wright at the boundary
slower length ball on the pads, goes for the pull but misses. Gets a leg-bye
length ball outside off, backs away and looks to hit out, misses
length ball around off, stays back and pushes it towards cover
length ball at the stumps, pulls it straight towards short midwicket
short of length outside off, gives himself some room and cuts it up and over and it carries all the way over deep cover
fuller around off, drives it inside out, Short puts in the chase and tries to flick it back but isn't successful
length ball at the stumps, Worrall leaves it alone
short of length, pulled away uncomfortably but is still effective as he finds the deep midwicket boundary
a slower short one outside off, Worrall picks it up but cannot connect the cut
fuller outside off from around the wicket. Siddle goes for the drive, gets a thick outside edge to the keeper. Strikers lose their eighth
fuller around off, Agar goes aerial towards long-off and collects a couple
back of the hand slower ball, length around off and middle, backs away and cuts it towards sweeper cover
another slower one and Worrall gives it his all, down the ground and smashes it over wide long-off for another six
a bouncer in response, Worrall was looking to pull it but had to bail out in the end
length ball outside off, chops it towards point
fuller at the stumps, backs away but gets the toe end of the bat, a single to covers
full, straight and fast, and does the trick. Under the bat of Agar and hits the off stump before the batsman could bring his bat down
length ball around off, taps it towards cover-point and sets off. And they get an overthrow as well
slower one but way down the leg side, a single to fine leg
another slower one, dabs it towards short third man
a yorker on the middle stump but Briggs does well to keep it out
fuller on the pads, and lofted towards deep midwicket, Short makes a diving stop to his left
fuller on the stumps and lofted over long-on this time, a couple of bounces and over the rope
short down the leg side and pulled away towards the vacant deep-backward leg region for four more
gets to his fifty. A brilliant yorker, jams his bat at it, looks at his partner who is already committed to the single and they do it easily in the end
fuller and angling across, looks to lap it away but it goes between his leg. An appeal for caught behind but denied
in the blockhole, squeezes it out towards covers
slower length ball, stays back and works it away towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, aims to go down the ground but gets an inside edge between the keeper and short fine leg
a yorker on the middle stump, Briggs keeps it out
slower one, length ball at the stumps and he has hit it over the deep midwicket boundary, a six for him now
an attempted yorker, Briggs takes it on the full and looks to work it on the leg side, an inside edge on to the pads
fuller outside off, moves across and paddles it past short fine leg for four more
length ball on the stumps, taps it towards short fine leg
fuller outside off, looks to drive, bounces towards cover off the outer half
beats short third man with a reverse sweep, gets a boundary. Are we on to something here?
tossed up outside off and Briggs goes again, another reverse sweep to get four more to third man
a slog sweep this time and Briggs gets enough bat on that to clear the deep midwicket boundary, 28 required from 13 now
flatter and quicker, Briggs was stuck on the back foot but manages to get it towards midwicket and they come back for the second
a low full toss outside off, hits it towards deep point, 150 comes up with that
goes for another wide yorker but ends up bowling a knee-height full toss, only a single though as Briggs hits it square of the wicket
loses his radar now while trying to bowl a quicker one. Way outside off
a yorker at the sixth stump, Worrall cannot get bat on that one
another yorker, this time much closer to the stumps, Worrall once again fails to put bat on the ball
in the slot and he gives it his all, finds the gap at extra cover and gets four
a low full toss outside off, hits it towards long-off for one
in the blockhole and Worrall NatMegs it towards fine leg for one
fuller at the stumps and steered away towards deep cover, only a single though
a full toss at the stumps but Worrall fails to put it away as he loses his shape. Still manages two to long-on
in the blockhole and Worrall can dig it out only to the bowler. That should calm the nerves in the Hurricanes camp
another attempted yorker, jams his bat at it and gets two to deep square leg
fuller, just outside the leg stump, Worrall aims for the trees but misses
